Articles.Content:
Last day I was playing KSP and landed like 10 spacecrafts on different planets and moons around the system, but today I loaded my save and some of the ships were missing and I couldn't find them anywhere, no sign at all, not even on the Tracking Station. They just vanished. And I know it wasn't some kind of rollback because ships I landed afterwards still there just fine. (A spacecraft orbiting a planet vanished too ).

Is that a game bug or something just went wrong with them I didn't saw?

I'm playing on version 0.90.0.705.

Edited January 14, 2015 by Vodro

Well, just to rule out the obvious, have you made sure you've not accidentally turned off display for those craft type(s)? Check the icons at the top of the Tracking Station screen and make sure all the icons are lit.

If they're well and truly missing, could you please upload the persistent.sfs file from the save so we can check it out?

That was the first thing I checked, no sign...

Here's the persistent.sfs: http://alturl.com/ijheo

Some stuff in some areas are missing in the .sfs like actions and part data. Without those the ship would not load and be skiping the that area then moving on. So the file might be corrupted. The bad thing is you can't fix the .sfs

I hope I helped.

Generally speaking, corrupt .sfs files refuse to load at all, and often even break the Load Game screen in a lot of cases. It's possible that errors can occur in KSP itself, causing it to think the craft were destroyed and thus remove them from the save file. It's quite unusual for that to happen, though.
Oh, so that's why, thanks everyone!
